 … to switch to manual mode.

Mobile Compass computes the current orientation using the three sensors:

 1. Gyroscope 
 2. Magnetometer 
 3. Accelerometer 

 The incremental orientation changes, read from the gyroscope, are integrated over time and used to update the orientation estimation. However, while the gyroscope offers the best reactivity and accuracy, it suffers badly from a systematic drift. 

 Therefore, the orientation estimation is constantly corrected using the data obtained from the accelerometer and the magnetometer.
